{{cpp/container/forward_list/title|forward_list}}
{{cpp/container/forward_list/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|
forward_list() : forward_list(Allocator()) {}
}}
{{dcl|num=2|
explicit forward_list( const Allocator&amp; alloc );
}}
{{dcl|num=3|1=
explicit forward_list( size_type count,
                       const Allocator&amp; alloc = Allocator() );
}}
{{dcl|num=4|1=
forward_list( size_type count, const T&amp; value,
       const Allocator&amp; alloc = Allocator() );
}}
{{dcl|num=5|1=
template&lt; class InputIt &gt;
forward_list( InputIt first, InputIt last,
              const Allocator&amp; alloc = Allocator() );
}}
{{dcl|num=6|since=c++23|1=
template&lt; container-compatible-range&lt;T&gt; R &gt;
forward_list( std::from_range_t, R&amp;&amp; rg,
              const Allocator&amp; alloc = Allocator() );
}}
{{dcl|num=7|
forward_list( const forward_list&amp; other );
}}
{{dcl|num=8|
forward_list( forward_list&amp;&amp; other );
}}
{{dcl rev begin|num=9}}
{{dcl|until=c++23|
forward_list( const forward_list&amp; other, const Allocator&amp; alloc );
}}
{{dcl|since=c++23|
forward_list( const forward_list&amp; other,
              const std::type_identity_t&lt;Allocator&gt;&amp; alloc );
}}
{{dcl rev end}}
{{dcl rev begin|num=10}}
{{dcl|until=c++23|
forward_list( forward_list&amp;&amp; other, const Allocator&amp; alloc );
}}
{{dcl|since=c++23|
forward_list( forward_list&amp;&amp; other,
              const std::type_identity_t&lt;Allocator&gt;&amp; alloc );
}}
{{dcl rev end}}
{{dcl|num=11|1=
forward_list( std::initializer_list&lt;T&gt; init,
              const Allocator&amp; alloc = Allocator() );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Constructs a new {{tt|forward_list}} from a variety of data sources, optionally using a user supplied allocator {{c|alloc}}.

@1@ The default constructor. Constructs an empty {{tt|forward_list}} with a default-constructed allocator.
@@ If {{tt|Allocator}} is not {{named req|DefaultConstructible}}, the behavior is undefined.

@2@ Constructs an empty {{tt|forward_list}} with the given allocator {{c|alloc}}.

@3@ Constructs a {{tt|forward_list}} with {{c|count}} default-inserted objects of {{tt|T}}. No copies are made.
@@ If {{tt|T}} is not {{named req|DefaultInsertable}} into {{c/core|std::forward_list&lt;T&gt;}}, the behavior is undefined.

@4@ Constructs a {{tt|forward_list}} with {{c|count}} copies of elements with value {{c|value}}.
@@ If {{tt|T}} is not {{named req|CopyInsertable}} into {{c/core|std::forward_list&lt;T&gt;}}, the behavior is undefined.

@5@ Constructs a {{tt|forward_list}} with the contents of the range {{range|first|last}}. Each iterator in {{range|first|last}} is dereferenced exactly once.
@@ {{cpp/enable if|{{tt|InputIt}} satisfies the requirements of {{named req|InputIterator}}}}.
@@ If {{tt|T}} is not {{named req|EmplaceConstructible}} into {{c/core|std::forward_list&lt;T&gt;}} from {{c|*first}}, the behavior is undefined.

@6@ Constructs a {{tt|forward_list}} with the contents of the range {{c|rg}}. Each iterator in {{c|rg}} is dereferenced exactly once.
@@ If {{tt|T}} is not {{named req|EmplaceConstructible}} into {{c/core|std::forward_list&lt;T&gt;}} from {{c|*ranges::begin(rg)}}, the behavior is undefined.

@7-10@ Constructs a {{tt|forward_list}} with the contents of {{c|other}}.

:@7@ The copy constructor. The allocator is obtained as if by calling {{c multi|std::allocator_traits&lt;Allocator&gt;::|    select_on_container_copy_construction|        (other.get_allocator())}}.

:@8@ The move constructor. The allocator is obtained by move construction from {{c|other.get_allocator()}}.

:@9@ Same as the copy constructor, except that {{c|alloc}} is used as the allocator.
:@@ If {{tt|T}} is not {{named req|CopyInsertable}} into {{c/core|std::forward_list&lt;T&gt;}}, the behavior is undefined.

:@10@ Same as the move constructor, except that {{c|alloc}} is used as the allocator.
:@@ If {{tt|T}} is not {{named req|MoveInsertable}} into {{c/core|std::forward_list&lt;T&gt;}}, the behavior is undefined.

@11@ Equivalent to {{c|forward_list(il.begin(), il.end(), alloc)}}.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|alloc|allocator to use for all memory allocations of this container}}
{{par|count|the size of the container}}
{{par|value|the value to initialize elements of the container with}}
{{par|first, last|the range to copy the elements from}}
{{par|other|another container to be used as source to initialize the elements of the container with}}
{{par|init|initializer list to initialize the elements of the container with}}
{{par|rg|a container compatible range}}
{{par end}}

===Complexity===
@1,2@ Constant.

@3,4@ Linear in {{c|count}}.

@5@ Linear in {{c|std::distance(first, last)}}.

@6@ Linear in {{c|ranges::distance(rg)}}.

@7@ Linear in {{c|other.size()}}.

@8@ Constant.

@9@ Linear in {{c|other.size()}}.

@10@ Linear in {{c|other.size()}} if {{c|1=alloc != other.get_allocator()}}, otherwise constant.

@11@ Linear in {{c|init.size()}}.

===Exceptions===
Calls to {{c|Allocator::allocate}} may throw.

===Notes===
{{cpp/container/lwg2321-note|8}}

{{feature test macro|__cpp_lib_containers_ranges|[[cpp/ranges/to#container compatible range|Ranges-aware]] construction and insertion; overload {{v|6}}|value=202202L|std=C++23}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;forward_list&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;string&gt;

template&lt;typename T&gt;
std::ostream&amp; operator&lt;&lt;(std::ostream&amp; s, const std::forward_list&lt;T&gt;&amp; v)
{
    s.put('{');
    for (char comma[]{'\0', ' ', '\0'}; const auto&amp; e : v)
        s &lt;&lt; comma &lt;&lt; e, comma[0] = ',';
    return s &lt;&lt; "}\n";
}

int main()
{
    // C++11 initializer list syntax:
    std::forward_list&lt;std::string&gt; words1{"the", "frogurt", "is", "also", "cursed"};
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "1: " &lt;&lt; words1;
    
    // words2 == words1
    std::forward_list&lt;std::string&gt; words2(words1.begin(), words1.end());
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "2: " &lt;&lt; words2;
    
    // words3 == words1
    std::forward_list&lt;std::string&gt; words3(words1);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "3: " &lt;&lt; words3;
    
    // words4 is {"Mo", "Mo", "Mo", "Mo", "Mo"}
    std::forward_list&lt;std::string&gt; words4(5, "Mo");
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "4: " &lt;&lt; words4;
    
    const auto rg = {"cat", "cow", "crow"};
#ifdef __cpp_lib_containers_ranges
    std::forward_list&lt;std::string&gt; words5(std::from_range, rg); // overload (6)
#else
    std::forward_list&lt;std::string&gt; words5(rg.begin(), rg.end()); // overload (5)
#endif
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "5: " &lt;&lt; words5;
}
|output=
1: {the, frogurt, is, also, cursed}
2: {the, frogurt, is, also, cursed}
3: {the, frogurt, is, also, cursed}
4: {Mo, Mo, Mo, Mo, Mo}
5: {cat, cow, crow}
}}
